classes.description: In this course we will examine the important problems in usability, Human Computer Interaction, User Interfaces, and Human Centered Computing. We will examine elements of HCI history, human information processing capabilities, HCI design, user interface prototyping, methods and new applications and directions in Human Computer Interaction.

comments.comment: Worked through the design thinking process. There is a group web design project instegated in 5 stages: empathize, define, ideate, prototype, and test.
Covered different aspects of design, like research and prototyping. Worked on a group design project.
Thought it was a cool class.

classes.description: Fundamentals and applications of the thermodynamics of phase and chemical reaction equilibrium; applications to industrial problems.
A continuation of DANCE 324. Taught on two campuses each semester. Location rotates among Mount Holyoke, Smith, and the University. Placement in the course is by Five College audition.

This course is a study of the origin, diagnosis, and treatment of special needs children with an emphasis on learning, goal planning, and understanding their intellectual, social, physical and sensory needs.
